clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Attentional Filter Training on Working Memory
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Cognitive Functions by Training Distractor Inhibition (DIIN) in Young and Old Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are interested in how attentional filter training/ distractor inhibition training could influence cognitive functions like working memory, executive control, problem solving, decision making and attentional control.

detailed_description.textblock: Two different computer based trainings were applied: an attentional filter training and a working memory training.

primary_outcome.description: Working memory and filtering performance (in %), effects of distractor interference and reaction times for trials with and without distractors with 4, 5 & 6 targets

secondary_outcome.description: Copying complex figures and reproduce it from memory

secondary_outcome.measure: Memory from TAP (Test battery of Attentional Performance)
Attention from TAP (Test battery of Attentional Performance)
secondary_outcome.description: divided attention, Go-NoGo, Flexibility, Incompatibility, Visual scanning
Repeating numbers in forward & backward conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: Subtest from CANTAB (Cambridge Neuropsychological Test Automated Battery)

secondary_outcome.description: subjective performance in the training paradigm
Assessing external circumstances of daily influences

secondary_outcome.measure: Memory performance without distractors among different setsizes
secondary_outcome.description: Working memory performance (in %) for trials with 4, 5 & 6 targets and averaged performance for all conditions without distractors

secondary_outcome.measure: Memory performance with distractors among different setsizes
secondary_outcome.description: Working memory performance (in %) for trials with 4, 5 & 6 targets and distractors and averaged performance for all conditions with distractors

secondary_outcome.measure: Filtering performance without distractors among different setsizes
secondary_outcome.description: Filtering performance (in %) for trials with 4, 5 & 6 targets and averaged performance for all conditions without distractors

secondary_outcome.measure: Filtering performance with distractors among different setsizes
secondary_outcome.description: Filtering performance (in %) for trials with 4, 5 & 6 targets and distractors and averaged performance for all conditions with distractors
Distractor inhibition (DIIN) = Mean of conditions without distractors - Mean of conditions with distractors

arm_group.description: Working memory training & attentional filter training for participants (18-30 years)
Working memory training, attentional filter training and no training (control) for participants (60-80 years)

intervention.description: one-week filter training on the computer: computerized visual change detection experiment (selective attention )
one-week storage training on the computer: computerized visual change detection experiment (memory storage)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- right-hander
- aged between 18-30 or 60-80years
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe visual impairments (e.g. dyschromatopsia, very low vision)
- diseases or medication that might impair test performance
- Montreal Cognitive Assessment Score (MoCA) < 26 points
